meanings.definition: To straighten out or separate crossed limbs or objects.
meanings.sent1: She had to uncross her legs to stand up.
meanings.sent2: Please uncross the wires to avoid a short circuit.
meanings.sent3: He tried to uncross the tangled shoelaces but ended up in a knot.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to uncross the linked rings with a wave of his hand.
meanings.sent5: The teacher showed the students how to uncross their arms for better posture.

meanings.definition: To remove a crossing or intersection.
meanings.sent1: The workers had to uncross the traffic cones after the roadwork was done.
meanings.sent2: I need to uncross the lines on this map to make it clearer.
meanings.sent3: She decided to uncross the paths of her two friends who were not getting along.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to uncross the conflicting statements to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to uncross the irrigation pipes to prevent water blockage.

meanings.definition: To reverse the action of crossing.
meanings.sent1: He had to uncross the X he mistakenly marked on the wrong spot.
meanings.sent2: The undo button helps you uncross any accidental lines you draw.
meanings.sent3: She tried to uncross the double-crossing paths on the treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The time traveler had to uncross his own timeline to fix the paradox.
meanings.sent5: The computer program can uncross the encrypted messages for security purposes.
